file_name: SmartRxSystemsInc_20180914_1-A_EX1A-6 MAT CTRCT_11351705_EX1A-6 MAT CTRCT_Distributor Agreement.pdf

perturbation.original_text:
4.
PAYMENT:
4.1 Payment. Payment to the Distributor for the sale of the Products to Customers shall be as follows:
(i) Company will pay Distributor (or its Assignee) Ten Percent (10%) of the Master Distributor Override generated by each
Customer Kiosk Location. (Master Distributor Override ("MDO") shall mean Total Revenue per Customer Kiosk Location collected by
SRXS from third party payors and patient cash payments). This 10% of the total revenue generated is payable only if the EBITDA is a
positive EBITDA and exceeds the 10% of the revenue. In cases of a positive EBITDA but shortage of funds compared to the 10% of the
revenue, Distributor will take less than 10%. If the EBITDA is negative, no payments will be made to Distributor. Additionally, it will be the
sole responsibility of Distributor to make a full disclosure of the 10% MDO to all its clients.
(ii) The MDO will be payable within ninety (90) days from the date of the transaction (First Month payable by the end of ninety
(90) days from the end of the month).
(iii) For each Customer Kiosk contracted and implemented by Distributor, Company shall also pay a management fee of 40% of
Net Income (Net Income for this purpose is defined as EBITDA less percentage paid to the client. The balance is then split 40%/60% to A3
Development Group, LLC and Smart RX Systems, Inc. respectively). Net Income is defined as total Customer revenue collections less all
incurred expenses, and is the distributable cash generated by each Customer location. These payments will also follow the payment policy
outlined in 4.1 above.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.
PAYMENT:
4.1 Payment. Payment to the Distributor for the sale of the Products to Customers shall be as follows:
(i) Company will pay Distributor (or its Assignee) Ten Percent (10%) of the Master Distributor Override generated by each
Customer Kiosk Location. (Master Distributor Override (“MDO”) shall mean Total Revenue per Customer Kiosk Location collected by
SRXS from third party payors and patient cash payments). This 10% of the total revenue generated is payable only if the EBITDA is a
positive EBITDA and exceeds the 10% of the revenue. In cases of a positive EBITDA but shortage of funds compared to the 10% of the
revenue, Distributor will take less than 10%. If the EBITDA is negative, no payments will be made to Distributor. Additionally, it will be the
sole responsibility of Distributor to make a full disclosure of the 10% MDO to all its clients.
(ii) The MDO will be payable within thirty (30) days from the date of the transaction (First Month payable by the end of thirty
(30) days from the end of the month).
(iii) For each Customer Kiosk contracted and implemented by Distributor, Company shall also pay a management fee of 40% of
Net Income (Net Income for this purpose is defined as EBITDA less percentage paid to the client. The balance is then split 40%/60% to A3
Development Group, LLC and Smart RX Systems, Inc. respectively). Net Income is defined as total Customer revenue collections less all
incurred expenses, and is the distributable cash generated by each Customer location. These payments will also follow the payment policy
outlined in 4.1 above.
perturbation.explanation: The payment terms are contradicted by changing the payment period for the MDO from 90 days to 30 days, while the subsequent paragraph regarding the management fee states that payments follow the policy in 4.1, this leads to a contradiction in the payment deadline of the management fee. This creates uncertainty and potential disputes over the applicable payment timeline.

perturbation.original_text:
12.1 Generally. This contract shall remain in effect initially for the five (5) year term ("Initial Term") from the date signed and shall be
automatically extended for one (1) year periods after the Initial Term ("Renewal Term") unless (i) either party provides written notice of its intention
not to renew the Agreement within 180 days prior to any Renewal Term; or (ii) this Agreement is otherwise terminated pursuant to the terms of this
Section 12.
perturbation.changed_text:
12.1 Generally. This contract shall remain in effect initially for the five (5) year term ("Initial Term") from the date signed and shall be
automatically extended for one (1) year periods after the Initial Term ("Renewal Term") unless (i) either party provides written notice of its intention
not to renew the Agreement within 180 days prior to any Renewal Term; or (ii) this Agreement is otherwise terminated pursuant to the terms of this
Section 12. Notwithstanding the above, the Company reserves the right to terminate the agreement at any time, without cause, with thirty (30) days written notice to the distributor.
perturbation.explanation: A clause is added that allows the company to terminate the agreement at any time without cause, which contradicts the original termination clauses. This creates uncertainty about the contract's stability and the distributor's investment security.

perturbation.original_text:
15.
CONTROLLING LAW:
15.1 Generally. This Distributor Agreement shall be exclusively governed, construed, enforced and controlled by the laws of the United
States of America and of the State of Texas. The parties agree that any controversy, claim, dispute, or disagreement arising under, out of, or relating
to this Distributor Agreement shall be exclusively submitted for resolution exclusively to courts of competent jurisdiction located in the County of
Orange, State of Florida, USA. Distributor consents and submits to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of such courts for the resolution of such
controversies, claims, disputes, or disagreements.
perturbation.changed_text:
15.
CONTROLLING LAW:
15.1 Generally. This Distributor Agreement shall be exclusively governed, construed, enforced and controlled by the laws of the United
States of America and of the State of Delaware. The parties agree that any controversy, claim, dispute, or disagreement arising under, out of, or relating
to this Distributor Agreement shall be exclusively submitted for resolution exclusively to courts of competent jurisdiction located in the County of
Orange, State of Florida, USA. Distributor consents and submits to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of such courts for the resolution of such
controversies, claims, disputes, or disagreements.
perturbation.explanation: There is an in-text contradiction where the agreement is governed by the laws of Texas, but now says Delaware. This contradiction is related to which state laws govern the contract and subsequent disputes, creating confusion regarding legal interpretation and enforcement.
